issues.description: Images no alt-text

issues.title: The html element should have a lang or xml:lang attribute which describes the language of the document.
issues.description:
<html class="ng-scope" ng-app="app"><head>
  <style>
   @font-face{...</html>

original_issue.message: The html element should have a lang or xml:lang attribute which describes the language of the document.

issues.title: <html> element must have a lang attribute
issues.description: Ensure every HTML document has a lang attribute

any.message: The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

issues.title: `<html>` element does not have a `[lang]` attribute
issues.description: If a page doesn't specify a `lang` attribute, a screen reader assumes that the page is in the default language that the user chose when setting up the screen reader. If the page isn't actually in the default language, then the screen reader might not announce the page's text correctly. [Learn more about the `lang` attribute](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/html-has-lang).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

issues.title: This emailinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description: <input class="required email" id="mce-EMAIL" name="EMAIL" ng-class="{ 'active': active }" ng-focus="active = true" placeholder="Newsletter" type="email" value="">

original_issue.message: This emailinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.context: <input class="required email" id="mce-EMAIL" name="EMAIL" ng-class="{ 'active': active }" ng-focus="active = true" placeholder="Newsletter" type="email" value="">

issues.title: Links do not have a discernible name
issues.description: Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. [Learn how to make links accessible](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-name).

issues.title: <ul> and <ol> must only directly contain <li>, <script> or <template> elements
issues.description: Ensure that lists are structured correctly

none.message: List element has direct children that are not allowed: div

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix all of the following:
  List element has direct children that are not allowed: div

issues.title: Lists do not contain only `<li>` elements and script supporting elements (`<script>` and `<template>`).
issues.description: Screen readers have a specific way of announcing lists. Ensuring proper list structure aids screen reader output. [Learn more about proper list structure](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/list).

node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  List element has direct children that are not allowed: div

issues.title: All page content should be contained by landmarks
issues.description: Ensure all page content is contained by landmarks

any.message: Some page content is not contained by landmarks

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Some page content is not contained by landmarks

name: Size; Target Size; Element too small

issues.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
issues.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (3.9px by 16.5px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 0px instead of at least 24px.
